did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Gay and Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation (GLAAD) records, 1985-2001

origination.label: Creator:

corpname.normal: Gay and Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation

origination.corpname: Gay and Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation.

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Administrative and subject files, correspondence, media kits, press releases, clippings, and files on the GLAAD Media Award events from the New York City, Atlanta, and Los Angeles offices.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: GLAAD works to ensure fair portrayal of lesbians and gays in all forms of media, from newspapers to major motion pictures.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Gay and Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Gay and Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation (GLAAD) records, #7669. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

defitem.label: Series I. New York Office Administrative Files
Series II. New York Office Media Alerts, Press Releases, and Clippings
Series III. Atlanta Office Administrative Files
Series IV. Atlanta Office Subject and Media Files
Series V. Los Angeles Office Subject and Media Files

did.unittitle: Series I. New York Office Administrative Files
Correspondence and Media Awards material (10 folders)
Program reports, by-laws, correspondence, meeting minutes
Board of Directors materials, Board Committees
Intranet and Internet: files re: establishing email and a web page and connecting GLAAD offices electronically
October Lesbian and Gay History Month packet
Media Monitor and Response Revitalization Project;
Board of Directors' meeting information and logistics;
Series II. New York Office Media Alerts, Press Releases, and Clippings
Clippings, media releases, GLAAD Alert, and "Video Activism," by Gay and Lesbian Mountaineers, distributed by GLAAD
Media packets on various topics including Dr. Laura Schlessinger, anti-gay radio personality, and Ellen Degeneres coming out on her TV show on April 30, 1997
Press kits and programs for GLAAD Media Award shows
Cassette tape: "Dr. Laura on... " compiled by GLAAD
Alliance for Gay and Lesbian Artists
As The World Turns TV show
Big Brother (anonymous person sending letters in the name of GLAAD)
Media Clippings Organized Alphabetically by Publication
New York B - New York P
New York P - New York T
W - X and Bound Media Clippings
Media Clippings Organized Alphabetically By Subject
Yo - Z and Bound Media Clippings
Unsorted Media Clippings And Press Materials
Series III. Atlanta Office Administrative Files
Atlanta office administrative files and miscellany ca. 1993-1994
Meeting minutes; by-laws; memoranda; media guide; meeting agendas; contact sheet; clippings
Series IV. Atlanta Office Subject and Media Files
Annual Membership Conference – Fund for Southern Communities.
Atlanta Gay and Lesbian Arts Festival
Consortium on Peace Research, Education and Development
Gay and Lesbian, Parents Coalition International
Georgia Advocates for Battered Woman and Children
Human Rights Action for Health Care
International Gay and Lesbian Human Rights Commission
Lesbian Gay Bisexual Workplace Issues Conference
National Lesbian and Gay Journalist Association
NY City Gay and Lesbian Anti-Violence Project
Olympics out of Cobb Press Pack
Parents, Friends, Family of Lesbians and Gays
Radio and TV News Directors Association
Gay and Lesbian Students and Education
Fight the Right Stuff to Mail
GLAAD Education Script for Media Workshop
The Parents Television Council Advisory Board
Fish: Stuff We Have Worked On
New York City Mayor's Gay and Lesbian Report
Queer Action Caucus/ON Letter to Lynn Articles
Southern Voice Contract with Glaad New York
Gay and Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation
Series V. Los Angeles Office Subject and Media Files

separatedmaterial.head: SEPARATED MATERIAL: Includes comic books from the "Comics, Cartoons" files in Series II. New York Office Media Alerts, Press Releases, and Clippings.
separatedmaterial.p: Tales of the Closet, published by the Hetrick-Martin Institute, v.1 nos.1-5, 1987-1990
Seven Miles A Second by David Wojnarowicz and James Romberger, 1996
Death. Gaiman, Neil, et. al. DC Comics: 1994
Real War Stories: Citizen Soldier, Eclipse Books, 1991
Metropolis S.C.U.: Special Crimes Unit, DC Comics, 4 issue mini-series, nos. 1-4, Nov.1994-Feb.1995
Northstar, Marvel Comics, v.1, nos.3-4 of 4, June-July 1994
Chiaroscuro: The Private Lives of Leonardo Da Vinci, DC Comics, Nos. 1-9, July 1995-Mar.1996
Quarantines and Death: The Far Right's Homophobic Agenda, by Mab Segrest and Leonard Zeskind, published by Center for Democratic Renewal and Education, 1991
This Week in Texas, Volume 20, Number 29, September 23-29, 1994, published by Texas Weekly Times Newspaper Company
World: The Journal of the Unitarian Universalist Association, Volume 8, Number 4, July/August 1994
World: The Journal of the Unitarian Universalist Association, Volume 8, Number 5, September/October 1994
A Magazine: The Asian American Quarterly, Volume 2, Number 3, Fall 1993
Alternatives: National Lesbian and Gay Journalists Association, Volume 4, Number 3, Summer 1994

1994 Atlanta Lesbian and Gay Pride Official Commemorative Program, June 1994, Official Commemorative Program for the 1994 Atlanta Pride Celebration, published by Southern Voice and The Atlanta Lesbian and Gay Pride Committee
